title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Professional Experience
Education
Prices and awards
Publications



Bioinformatician



School of Infection & Immunity, University of Glasgow


2024–Present



Developed advanced pipelines and methods for single-cell and spatial transcriptomics datasets (CosMx), tailored to study neuroinflammation.
Investigated gene expression differences caused by inflammation at the cell-type, regional, and niche levels using cutting-edge spatial transcriptomics technology.
Collaborated with wet lab researchers to ensure high-quality outputs and integrative analysis of small, high-value tissue samples.

Demonstrator in Bioinformatics



British Society for Immunology


2025–Present





School of Infection & Immunity, University of Glasgow


2023–2024



Mentored students in R and Python programming, Linux shell scripting, and omics data analysis.
Conducted tutorials on data visualization and statistical analysis for bioinformatics research.

Intern in Genetics Research



School of Molecular Biosciences, University of Glasgow


09/2022–03/2023



Analysed genomic structural variations using long-read sequencing technologies, including Oxford Nanopore NGS.
Leveraged genetic expertise to provide unique insights into sequencing data, connecting findings to broader biological implications.







MSc. Bioinformatics. University of Glasgow

Ecuadorian Government Full Scholarship for scoring in the top 1% on Ecuador’s National Higher Education Entrance Exam (worth USD 250K) to study at the University of Glasgow.

title: Welcome
text:
I’m a bioinformatician at the University of Glasgow, specialising in single-cell and spatial transcriptomics with a focus on inflammation and tissue organisation. I analyse CosMx SMI datasets and build reproducible, multi-sample workflows covering quality control, integration, cell-type annotation, differential expression, and pathway enrichment, translating results into clear, testable biological insights for wet-lab collaborators.
I hold a BSc (Hons) in Genetics (2019–2023) and an MSc in Bioinformatics (2023–2024), both from the University of Glasgow, and I draw on a strong foundation in molecular and cellular biology to work across diverse life-science questions. Alongside my research, I’ve taught R, Python, and shell scripting.
I’m also interested in applying AI and machine learning to health research.
Current interests: spatial neighbourhoods/microenvironments, differential expression & pathway analysis, and robust pipelines for multi-sample studies.




Me!

title: Welcome
text:
What I do

Spatial transcriptomics analysis (CosMx and related platforms)
Workflow / pipeline development (reproducible, multi-sample)
Differential expression and enrichment (cell-type and region-level)
Clear reporting for wet lab collaborators
